III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150 Incident reporting.
Section (1) Any incident resulting in serious injury of a resident or
Description illness requiring inpatient hospitalization, shall be reported to
the parent/ legal guardian, responsible referring agency, and
the licensing authority as soon as possible, but not more than
24 hours after the incident.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or around 12/09/23 or 12/10/23, Youth A was stabbed in the
left forearm with a pencil by another youth while trying to break up
a fight. Youth A has bruising on the left forearm and was treated
by a nurse at the facility. The facility did not notify Youth A’s foster
care worker, probation office, or parents of the incident.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
12/18/2023.
Interviews:
I contacted complainant on 12/18/2023, no additional information
was provided.
I spoke with Youth A’s Foster Care Worker on 12/18/2023. She
reported Youth A has been at the facility for five months and
usually she is notified of incidents involving Youth A, but she was
not notified of this incident.
I interviewed Clinical Manager on 12/19/2023 at the facility.
Clinical Manager reported there was a physical altercation
involving three youths, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D, on
12/12/2023. Youth A was not directly involved but she tried to
break up the fight. She said Youth A reported after the fight she
got poked with a pencil. Youth A was seen by the nurse and the
nurse removed a small piece of lead from her lower arm. Clinical
Manager reported the supervisors would have notified the parents,
guardians, and workers of an incident involving a youth requiring
medical care for a serious injury. Youth A was not directly involved
in this incident and did not sustain a serious injury.
I interviewed Youth A on 12/19/2023 at the facility. Youth A has
been at the facility since August 2023. She reported last week
there was a fight between three youths, Youth B, Youth C, and
Youth D, on the Pod. She said Staff 1, Staff 2 and Supervisor 1
were on the pod. Staff 1 initially tried to talk to the youths, but the
2

youths kept arguing and they attacked each other. She said Staff
1 immediately tried to separate the girls and she also intervened
trying to help the staff. Youth A thinks Youth B stabbed her with a
pencil and that’s how she got the lead in her arm. Youth A was
examined by the nurse, who removed the piece of lead from the
arm. Youth A reported feeling safe and did not express any
concerns regarding the staff or the facility.
I interviewed Youth B on 12/19/2023 at the facility. Youth B has
been at the facility for three months. She recalled getting into a
fight with Youth C and Youth D on 12/12/23. She said Youth A
was not involved in the fight. She denied having a pencil or
stabbing anyone with a pencil during the fight. She said Staff 1
and Staff 2 immediately intervened and separated her and Youth
C. Youth B denied getting hurt or needing medical care.
I interviewed Youth C on 12/19/2023 at the facility. Youth C has
been at the facility for one month. She recalled she and Youth B
were involved in a fight on 12/12/23. She said Staff 1, Staff 2 and
Supervisor 1 were on the Pod. Youth C said staff immediately
called security and stopped the fight. She does not recall Youth A
intervening in the fight. She denied having a pencil during the fight
and did not witness Youth A getting stabbed with a pencil.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 12/21/23 at the facility. Supervisor
1 reported she was on the pod with the staff during the incident on
12/12/2023. She said Youth A was not involved in the fight and
when she tried to intervene, she was redirected away. She said
after the fight Youth A reported she got struck with a pencil, so
supervisor 2 took Youth A to be examined by the nurse.
Supervisor 1 said they searched the pod and the bedrooms after
the incident and did not find a pencil. Supervisor 1 thinks Youth A
may have poked herself with the pencil during school, because
that is the only time the youths have access to pencils. Supervisor
1 said Youth A did not have a serious injury and that is the reason
the foster care worker was not notified. The facility’s policy is the
supervisor would immediately notify the parent, guardian, and
worker when a youth has a serious injury that requires medical
attention.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 12/21/2023 at the facility. Staff 1 reported
on 12/12/2023 a fight broke out between Youth B , Youth C and
Youth D; staff called for security and immediately separated the
two youths. Youth A did attempt to intervene, but she was
redirected away from the other youths. Youth A reported after the
fight, that she got stabbed with a pencil. She denied Youth B had
a pencil and did not witness anyone stab or strike Youth A. She
said the pod and rooms were searched and there was no pencil
3

found. Youth A was examined by the nurse, and she did have a
small piece of lead in her lower arm. The nurse removed the lead,
cleaned the area, and put a band-aide on her arm.
I interviewed Supervisor 2 on 01/10/2024 at the facility.
Supervisor 2 has been working at the facility for one year.
Supervisor 2 reported she was called to the Pod on 12/12/2023
when the fight broke out. Supervisor 2 didn’t witness the fight,
because when she arrived on the Pod, staff had already
separated the youths. Supervisor 2 said Youth A was upset and
reported that she got stabbed with a pencil during the fight. She
took Youth A to see the nurse and the nurse removed the lead
from her arm. Supervisor 2 reported the facility’s policy is that the
supervisor notifies the parents, guardians, and workers of an
incident involving a youth requiring medical care for a serious
injury. Youth A was not directly involved in the fight and did not
sustain a serious injury, therefore it was not required that the
worker be notified of the incident.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 12/12/2023, written by Supervisor 1,
Youth B and Youth C engaged in a verbal dispute. Staff 1
and staff 2 attempted to verbally de-escalate the situation
but was unsuccessful. Youth C struck Youth B in the face,
Youth B punched Youth C, Staff 1 and Staff 2 intervened
and separated the Youths. Youth B and Youth C were not
injured.
• Medical assessment for Youth A dated 12/12/2023,
completed by Nurse. Youth A was seen in the clinic after
being poked with a pencil during the incident on the pod.
Nurse removed a pointed edge with tweezers from Youth
A’s left arm.
• Facility’s Critical Incident Policy. This policy outlines the
criteria and requirements for staff to complete an unusual
incident report and a critical incident report. Critical
Incidents are of the following: allegations of abuse and/or
neglect, incident requiring police involvement, incident
requiring medical attention from an outside provider, death,
suicide attempts, and youth escapes.
4

Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documents reviewed, no
violation is found. The staff responded appropriately in their
approaches to keep all youth safe during the fight. Youth A was
seen by the nurse, and a medical assessment was completed.
Youth A was not directly involved in the fight and did not sustain a
serious injury; therefore, it was not required that the worker be
notified of the incident involving Youth A.
Technical Assistance
If a youth becomes involved in a situation to help protect another
youth, staff need to instruct youth to back away and not get
involved for their own safety.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
